isis.stitle: TSI 01-08-06 - Troubleshooting Intermittent Instrument Panel Data Link Gauges and Fuel Gauge that Lock-up or Freeze in Position in 5000i and 9000i Models Built Between February 21, 2000 and April 18, 2001 with Instrument Panels that have a Date Code Less Than 1501

subjectgroup.subject: Troubleshooting Intermittent Instrument Panel Data Link Gauges and Fuel Gauge that Lock-up or Freeze in Position in 5000i and 9000i Models Built Between February 21, 2000 and April 18, 2001 with Instrument Panels that have a Date Code Less Than 1501

geninfo.para: Intermittent lockup of the road speed, engine speed, engine coolant, engine oil pressure and voltmeter data link driven gauges and the fuel gauge may occur in instrument panels with a date code prior to 1501 (manufactured during week 15, year 2001) used in 5000i and 9000i Models built between February 21, 2000 and April 18, 2001.

step1.para: If the customer complaint is that the cluster appears to either lock up or freeze, first verify all power connections and grounds are clean and tight. Note that the cluster will normally resume functioning when ignition power is cycled.

If the cluster appears to lock up on specific events, such as during Jake Brake operation, verify the electrical circuits for that particular feature. Specifically look for shorted circuits, or chafed wires on that system.
After verification of the electrical system, if there are no apparent problems with the vehicle or cluster, replace the instrument cluster circuit board housing.
Ensure that the date code on the replacement cluster is after '1501'.
